title: Free regions in optimized MIR when compiling futures-util with -Zmir-opt-level=3

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-debug-assertions
labels.description: This issue requires debug-assertions in some way

body:
### Code ``` RUSTFLAGS="-Zmir-opt-level=3" cargo +master-stage1 b --release --all-features ``` building a download of `futures-util v0.3.26` (found trying to install the latest `cargo-lambda`) ### Meta This uh doesn't reproduce on current nightly, because the ICE is from a debug assertion. My `master-stage` is a stage1 build of commit `44cfafe2fafe816395d3acc434663a45d5178c41`, with debug assertions enabled. The assertion is here: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/bb1838847d8bb568a1bd4c4c434c6173c174a496/compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/lib.rs#L629 ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Free regions in optimized MIR', compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/lib.rs:629:5 ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Free regions in optimized MIR', compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/lib.rs:629:5 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f54566eb3c4 - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::h7966bd9c0da533fe at /home/ben/rust-master/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:93:5 1: 0x7f54566eb3c4 -
